page.title: 01Barrhill Village
page.content: Barrhill Village is a small village with a population of about 300 people. It is situated on the A714 and stands approximately 300 feet above sea level. The immediate area of the village is surrounded by farming and forestry land and two large estates, Ballochmorrie and Kildonan. Barrhill village is the shopping/business centre for the many small farms in the area. The main road (A714) through Barrhill follows the valley of the River Duisk and runs parrallel to the railway which is the main commercial rail link with Stranraer/London/Glasgow and Irish Ferry. The A714 is the tourist route of the Galloway Hills and Glentrool Forest Park. Barrhill has 3 main industries (a) a civelengineering firm which is involved in the construction of roads, bridges and commercial
